question.body: The parameter of interest is p, the proportion of college students who report that computer gaming is an obstacle to their success in college. The null hypothesis claims that p = 0.30. Which of the following give the most convincing evidence against Ho?

multiple_choice.choice: A sample of 10 students in which 4 report that computer gaming an obstacle to their success in college.
A sample of 100 students in which 40 report that computer gaming an obstacle to their success in college.
A sample of 1,000 students in which 400 report that computer gaming an obstacle to their success in college.
All of these are equally strong evidence against Ho since p-hat = 0.40 for each sample.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Pay attention to the sample size. Which do you think gives a more accurate picture of the true population proportion: a small sample or a large sample?
Incorrect. Pay attention to the sample size. Which sample gives a more accurate picture of the true population proportion?

Incorrect. It is true that the sample proportion is 0.40 for each situation, but pay attention to the sample size. Which do you think gives a more accurate picture of the true population proportion: a small sample or a large sample?
